metadata.title: CVE-2019-19462 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
relay_open in kernel/relay.c in the Linux kernel through 5.4.1 allows localusers to cause a denial of service (such as relay blockage) by triggering aNULL alloc_percpu result.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19462` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-42-generic - 5.4.0-42.46
linux-image-5.4.0-42-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-42.46
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-42-generic - 5.4.0-42.46
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-42-lowlatency - 5.4.0-42.46
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1020-kvm - 5.4.0-1020.20
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1020-aws - 5.4.0-1020.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1022-azure - 5.4.0-1022.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1021-gcp - 5.4.0-1021.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1021-oracle - 5.4.0-1021.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.6.0-1018-oem - 5.6.0-1018.18
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1015-raspi - 5.4.0-1015.15
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-42.46').
linux-kvm package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1020.20').
linux-aws package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1020.20').
linux-azure package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1022.22').
linux-gcp package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1021.21').
linux-oracle package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1021.21').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
linux-oem-5.6 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.0-1018.18').
linux-raspi package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-1015.15').
